segment.source: Resolving an Issue (Windows 10)
segment.target: Resolving an Issue (Windows 10)

segment.source: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.
segment.target: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.

segment.source: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.
segment.target: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.

segment.source: Resolving an Issue
segment.target: Resolving an Issue

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.
segment.target: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.

segment.source: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.
segment.target: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.

segment.source: Resolving an issue is not required.
segment.target: Resolving an issue is not required.

segment.source: However, if you do not resolve the issue, the issue remains active in your ACT database and provides inaccurate reports.
segment.target: However, if you do not resolve the issue, the issue remains active in your ACT database and provides inaccurate reports.

segment.source: Resolving Issues for Your Applications and Websites
segment.target: Resolving Issues for Your Applications and Websites

segment.source: This procedure describes how to resolve an existing issue that is documented in ACM.
segment.target: This procedure describes how to resolve an existing issue that is documented in ACM.

segment.source: For information about adding an issue, see Adding or Editing an Issue.
segment.target: For information about adding an issue, see Adding or Editing an Issue.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following example uses the ApplicationName dialog box.
segment.target: The following example uses the ApplicationName dialog box.

segment.source: The procedure is similar for websites.
segment.target: The procedure is similar for websites.

segment.source: To resolve issues
segment.target: To resolve issues

segment.source: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, double-click the name of the application to display the ApplicationName dialog box.
segment.target: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, double-click the name of the application to display the ApplicationName dialog box.

segment.source: Click the Issues tab.
segment.target: Click the Issues tab.

segment.source: Double-click the specific issue to resolve.
segment.target: Double-click the specific issue to resolve.

segment.source: On the Actions menu, click Resolve, and then close the ApplicationNameIssueTitle dialog box.
segment.target: On the Actions menu, click Resolve, and then close the ApplicationNameIssueTitle dialog box.

segment.source: The issue appears with a green check mark in the report details screen.
segment.target: The issue appears with a green check mark in the report details screen.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you have not entered a solution but have resolved the issue, Microsoft recommends that you enter a solution with Other solution type and add text that describes why you resolved the issue without a solution.
segment.target: If you have not entered a solution but have resolved the issue, Microsoft recommends that you enter a solution with Other solution type and add text that describes why you resolved the issue without a solution.

segment.source: For information about entering solutions, see Adding or Editing a Solution.
segment.target: For information about entering solutions, see Adding or Editing a Solution.
